page.title: 10The Devon County Show.
page.content: The showground is situated quite a distance from Exeter's town centre next to St James High School.The show is held annually on three consecutive days by the Devon County Agricultural Association. Every year great preparations are made in setting up the large tents (marquees). The show usually takes place in May, and farmers from all over Devon take part by bringing their animals and produce. In May 1985,{H.R.H Princess Anne,} daughter of{Queen Elizabeth II} opened the show. Most of the activities are looked at and judged. You can see horses being shoed and sheep being sheared, which is a great skill. Many thousands come to visit and this year St James High School won two awards for their exhibition in the Schools Tent. By Richard Hayden.Age 13.
